Cadillac CTS sedan:


Engine: 3.2-liter, 220-h.p. V-6;
Fuel economy: 18 m.p.g. city/20 highway.
Not a Chevy in disguise, but rather an all-new rear-wheel-drive, entry-level luxury sedan with dynamic styling to be shared with a host of future models coming out in the next 18 months. Beefed-up V-6 teamed with a 5-speed manual as standard, in part to keep base price less than $30,000. With options, however, such as $1,200 automatic, expect to spend about $35,000. RWD for Snow Belt? Don't worry, four-wheel ABS and an all-speed traction control are standard and sure-footed StabiliTrak is optional with sport package recommended for serious drivers. Side air bag curtains also standard. Styling, performance, room, comfort and luxury amenities to win over younger buyers.

Jim's driveway: Capsules of Jim Mateja's auto reviews.
Mateja, Jim
Tribune News Service
October 11, 2002
